cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi NE of Havana, Cuba and 60 mi S of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico tonight, then turning WNW Monday and NW Tuesday toward the northeast Gulf Coast of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, Florida peninsula, Florida Big Bend, and coastal Georgia/South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late week; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤15% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Plaquemines Port District based on current track well east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only isolated light rain bands possible; heavy rainfall focus is over Florida.
